If you earn $30 an hour at the office, chances are you’d like to earn at least $30 an hour from your photography. If you are a full time photographer, you can work backwards from what you need to earn in a year to support your family and your lifestyle. For example, if I want to earn the equivalent of $30 per hour for a 40 hour work week, but I can only bill 20 hours, I have to bill $60 per hour. I am still working 40 hours per week, but only 50% can be billed to a client so my billable rate doubles.
